title: 104_s1573
content: The Act titled "Taxpayers' Cancer Research Funding Act of 1996" designates income tax payments to the Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Every individual (excluding nonresident aliens) with an adjusted income tax liability of $5 or more can designate $5 to the Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund. For joint filers with a liability of $10 or more, each spouse can designate $5 to the fund. Adjusted income tax liability is the individual's income tax liability minus any previous designations. Individuals can designate $5 to the Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund when filing their tax return, or at any other time specified by the Secretary. Designation must be made as prescribed by regulations, either on the first page of the return or on the page with the taxpayer's signature. Chapter 98 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new section related to the establishment of trust funds. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to establish a new section related to trust funds, including the creation of a Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund under SEC. 9512. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to establish the `Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund' trust fund in the Treasury. Amounts designated under section 6098 are appropriated to the fund for making qualified research grants, supplementing existing funding. The Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund trust fund in the Treasury will provide qualified research grants for research on breast and prostate cancer, administered by the National Cancer Institute. Qualified peer review will determine grant recipients. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new item in the table of parts for subchapter A of chapter 61. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new section titled "Breast and Prostate Cancer Research Fund" under subchapter A of chapter 98. The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1995.
